poem:
Title: Upon A Ceasefire Proposal

Winged words, fragile as a nestling,
Fly from the lips of power,
Hamas has accepted, Washington,
Mulls over. 
Beneath the shadow of the Eagle,
Broken children of Rafah
Wait with Gaza's breath,
Held in the questions air.
Will the bombs still fall –
As rain in the desert?
Pity writes an uncertain script,
And we, hearts bound, are the penned hands.
